artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Muneoka Nobukichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 460.12; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 182, p. 278.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; man on a white horse with another man falling in foreground, with feet in the air; man on horse wears multicolored armor and red, black and patterned garments; falling figures wears green, white, black and red armor, and blue and white pants
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫工宗岡 {horikō Muneoka}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Yoshitoshi's Unsurpassed Warriors (Yoshitoshi musha burui 芳年武者旡類)
title: Sagami Jirō Taira Masakado
